wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Buckler (24 April 1882 – 19 March 1921) was a Welsh professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for Wales, and at club level for Salford, as a forward (prior to the specialist positions of; prop, hooker, second-row, loose forward), during the era of contested scrums.

link_mentions.page: List of family relations in rugby league
response: *Arthur Buckler (1882–1921), Wales & Salford; brother of Herbert
Herbert Buckler was the older brother of the rugby league footballer; Arthur Buckler.

link_mentions.page: List of Salford Red Devils players
response: * Arthur Buckler won a cap for Wales while at Salford in 1908 against England
